args.name: region

args.name: flavor_id

(Optional) The ID of the flavor. Conflicts with the name,

args.name: ram

args.name: disk

args.name: vcpus

args.name: swap

args.name: rx_tx_factor

attrs.name: is_public

attrs.name: docker_volume_size

attrs.name: master_flavor

attrs.name: keypair

attrs.name: labels

attrs.name: node_count

attrs.name: master_addresses

attrs.name: node_addresses

attrs.name: stack_id

attrs.description: The project of the cluster template.

attrs.name: user_id
attrs.description: The user of the cluster template.

attrs.name: created_at
attrs.description: The time at which cluster template was created.

attrs.name: updated_at
attrs.description: The time at which cluster template was updated.

attrs.name: apiserver_port
attrs.description:
The API server port for the Container Orchestration
Engine for this cluster template.

attrs.name: coe
attrs.description: The Container Orchestration Engine for this cluster template.

attrs.name: cluster_distro
attrs.description: The distro for the cluster (fedora-atomic, coreos, etc.).

attrs.name: dns_nameserver
attrs.description:
Address of the DNS nameserver that is used in nodes of the
cluster.

attrs.name: docker_storage_driver
attrs.description:
Docker storage driver. Changing this updates the
Docker storage driver of the existing cluster template.

attrs.name: docker_volume_size
attrs.description: The size (in GB) of the Docker volume.

attrs.name: external_network_id
attrs.description:
The ID of the external network that will be used for
the cluster.

attrs.name: fixed_network
attrs.description: The fixed network that will be attached to the cluster.

attrs.name: fixed_subnet
attrs.description: =The fixed subnet that will be attached to the cluster.

attrs.name: flavor
attrs.description: The flavor for the nodes of the cluster.

attrs.name: master_flavor
attrs.description: The flavor for the master nodes.

attrs.name: floating_ip_enabled
attrs.description:
Indicates whether created cluster should create IP
floating IP for every node or not.

attrs.name: http_proxy
attrs.description:
The address of a proxy for receiving all HTTP requests and
relay them.

attrs.name: https_proxy
attrs.description:
The address of a proxy for receiving all HTTPS requests and
relay them.

attrs.name: image
attrs.description: The reference to an image that is used for nodes of the cluster.

attrs.name: insecure_registry
attrs.description: The insecure registry URL for the cluster template.

attrs.name: keypair_id
attrs.description: The name of the Compute service SSH keypair.

attrs.name: labels
attrs.description:
The list of key value pairs representing additional properties
of the cluster template.

attrs.name: master_lb_enabled
attrs.description:
Indicates whether created cluster should has a
loadbalancer for master nodes or not.

attrs.name: network_driver
attrs.description: The name of the driver for the container network.

attrs.name: no_proxy
attrs.description:
A comma-separated list of IP addresses that shouldn't be used in
the cluster.

attrs.name: public
attrs.description: Indicates whether cluster template should be public.

attrs.name: registry_enabled
attrs.description:
Indicates whether Docker registry is enabled in the
cluster.

attrs.name: server_type
attrs.description: The server type for the cluster template.

attrs.name: tls_disabled
attrs.description: Indicates whether the TLS should be disabled in the cluster.

attrs.name: volume_driver
attrs.description:
The name of the driver that is used for the volumes of the
cluster nodes.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 DNS client.
A DNS client is needed to retrieve zone ids. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) The name of the zone.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) A description of the zone.

args.name: email
args.description: (Optional) The email contact for the zone record.

args.name: status
args.description: (Optional) The zone's status.

args.name: ttl
args.description: (Optional) The time to live (TTL) of the zone.

args.name: type
args.description: (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be PRIMARY or SECONDARY.

attrs.name: attributes
attrs.description: Attributes of the DNS Service scheduler.

attrs.name: masters
attrs.description: An array of master DNS servers. When type is  SECONDARY.

attrs.name: created_at
attrs.description: The time the zone was created.

attrs.name: updated_at
attrs.description: The time the zone was last updated.

attrs.name: transferred_at
attrs.description: The time the zone was transferred.

attrs.name: serial
attrs.description: The serial number of the zone.

attrs.name: pool_id
attrs.description: The ID of the pool hosting the zone.

attrs.name: project_id
attrs.description: The project ID that owns the zone.

args.name: region

attrs.name: audited
attrs.description: The audit status of the firewall policy.

attrs.name: shared
attrs.description: The sharing status of the firewall policy.

attrs.name: rules
attrs.description: The array of one or more firewall rules that comprise the policy.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Glance client.
A Glance client is needed to create an Image that can be used with
a compute instance. If omitted, the region argument of the provider
is used.

args.name: most_recent
args.description:
(Optional) If more than one result is returned, use the most
recent image.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) The name of the image.

args.name: owner
args.description: (Optional) The owner (UUID) of the image.

args.name: properties
args.description:
(Optional) a map of key/value pairs to match an image with.
All specified properties must be matched.

args.name: size_min
args.description: (Optional) The minimum size (in bytes) of the image to return.

args.name: size_max
args.description: (Optional) The maximum size (in bytes) of the image to return.

args.name: sort_direction
args.description: (Optional) Order the results in either asc or desc.

args.name: sort_key
args.description: (Optional) Sort images based on a certain key. Defaults to name.

args.name: tag
args.description: (Optional) Search for images with a specific tag.

args.name: visibility
args.description:
(Optional) The visibility of the image. Must be one of
"public", "private", "community", or "shared". Defaults to "private".

args.name: member_status
args.description:
(Optional) The status of the image. Must be one of
"accepted", "pending", "rejected", or "all".

attrs.name: checksum
attrs.description: The checksum of the data associated with the image.

attrs.name: created_at
attrs.description: The date the image was created.

attrs.name: container_format
attrs.description: : The format of the image's container.

attrs.name: disk_format
attrs.description: : The format of the image's disk.

attrs.name: file
attrs.description:
the trailing path after the glance endpoint that represent the
location of the image or the path to retrieve it.

attrs.name: metadata
attrs.description:
The metadata associated with the image.
Image metadata allow for meaningfully define the image properties
and tags. See https://docs.openstack.org/glance/latest/user/metadefs-concepts.html.

attrs.name: min_disk_gb
attrs.description: The minimum amount of disk space required to use the image.

attrs.name: min_ram_mb
attrs.description: The minimum amount of ram required to use the image.

attrs.name: protected
attrs.description: Whether or not the image is protected.

attrs.name: schema
attrs.description:
The path to the JSON-schema that represent
the image or image

attrs.name: size_bytes
attrs.description: The size of the image (in bytes).

attrs.name: tags
attrs.description: The tags list of the image.

attrs.name: updated_at
attrs.description: The date the image was last updated.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Neutron client.
A Neutron client is needed to retrieve address-scopes. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) Name of the address-scope.

args.name: ip_version
args.description: (Optional) IP version.

args.name: shared
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether this address-scope is shared across
all projects.

args.name: project_id
args.description: (Optional) The owner of the address-scope.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Neutron client.
A Neutron client is needed to retrieve floating IP ids. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable description of the floating IP.

args.name: address
args.description: (Optional) The IP address of the floating IP.

args.name: pool
args.description: (Optional) The name of the pool from which the floating IP belongs to.

args.name: port_id
args.description: (Optional) The ID of the port the floating IP is attached.

args.name: status
args.description: status of the floating IP (ACTIVE/DOWN).

args.name: fixed_ip
args.description: (Optional) The specific IP address of the internal port which should be associated with the floating IP.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) The list of floating IP tags to filter.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description: (Optional) The owner of the floating IP.

attrs.name: all_tags
attrs.description: A set of string tags applied on the floating IP.

attrs.name: dns_name
attrs.description:
The floating IP DNS name. Available, when Neutron DNS extension
is enabled.

attrs.name: dns_domain
attrs.description:
The floating IP DNS domain. Available, when Neutron DNS
extension is enabled.

args.name: region
args.description:

A Neutron client is needed to retrieve networks ids. If omitted, the

args.name: network_id
args.description: (Optional) The ID of the network.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) The name of the network.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable description of the network.

args.name: status
args.description: (Optional) The status of the network.

args.name: external
args.description: (Optional) The external routing facility of the network.

args.name: matching_subnet_cidr
args.description: (Optional) The CIDR of a subnet within the network.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description: (Optional) The owner of the network.

args.name: availability_zone_hints
args.description: (Optional) The availability zone candidates for the network.

args.name: transparent_vlan
args.description:
(Optional) The VLAN transparent attribute for the
network.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) The list of network tags to filter.

args.name: mtu
args.description:
(Optional) The network MTU to filter. Available, when Neutron net-mtu
extension is enabled.

attrs.name: admin_state_up
attrs.description: The administrative state of the network.

attrs.name: shared
attrs.description:
Specifies whether the network resource can be accessed by any
tenant or not.

attrs.name: availability_zone_hints
attrs.description: The availability zone candidates for the network.

attrs.name: all_tags
attrs.description: The set of string tags applied on the network.

attrs.name: dns_domain
attrs.description:
The network DNS domain. Available, when Neutron DNS extension
is enabled

args.name: region

args.description: (Optional) The name of the router.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description: (Optional) Administrative up/down status for the router (must be "true" or "false" if provided).

args.name: distributed
args.description: (Optional) Indicates whether or not to get a distributed router.

args.name: status
args.description: (Optional) The status of the router (ACTIVE/DOWN).

args.name: tags

attrs.name: external_fixed_ip

args.description: (Optional) The owner of the subnet.

addresses that can be active on this port. The structure is described

args.name: name

strings.

(Optional) A share status filter. A valid value is creating,
error, available, deleting, error_deleting, manage_starting,

length.

args.name: segmentation_id

args.name: cidr
args.description: (Optional) The share network CIDR.

args.name: ip_version
args.description: (Optional) The IP version of the share network. Can either be 4 or 6.

attrs.name: project_id

attrs.name: security_service_ids

the share network.

args.name: status

unmanage_error or error_deleting.

attrs.name: share_id

attrs.name: share_proto

attrs.name: share_size

args.name: region

omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new volume.

args.name: size

args.name: name

volume's name.

args.name: description

the volume's description.

args.name: availability_zone

args.name: image_id

args.name: snapshot_id

args.name: source_vol_id

args.name: region

(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Block Storage

args.name: attach_mode
args.description:
(Optional) Specify whether to attach the volume as Read-Only
(ro) or Read-Write (rw). Only values of ro and rw are accepted.
If left unspecified, the Block Storage API will apply a default of rw.

args.name: device
args.description:
(Optional) The device to tell the Block Storage service this
volume will be attached as. This is purely for informational purposes.
You can specify auto or a device such as /dev/vdc.

args.description: (Required) The host to attach the volume to.

args.name: initiator
args.description: (Optional) The iSCSI initiator string to make the connection.

args.name: ip_address
args.description: (Optional) The IP address of the host_name above.

args.name: multipath

args.name: os_type
args.description: (Optional) The iSCSI initiator OS type.

args.name: platform
args.description: (Optional) The iSCSI initiator platform.

args.name: volume_id

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.
Flavors are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to
create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used.
Changing this creates a new flavor.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) A unique name for the flavor. Changing this creates a new
flavor.

args.name: ram
args.description:
(Required) The amount of RAM to use, in megabytes. Changing this
creates a new flavor.

args.name: vcpus
args.description:
(Required) The number of virtual CPUs to use. Changing this creates
a new flavor.

args.name: disk
args.description:
(Required) The amount of disk space in gigabytes to use for the root
(/) partition. Changing this creates a new flavor.

args.name: swap
args.description:
(Optional) The amount of disk space in megabytes to use. If
unspecified, the default is 0. Changing this creates a new flavor.

args.name: rx_tx_factor
args.description:
(Optional) RX/TX bandwith factor. The default is 1. Changing
this creates a new flavor.

args.name: is_public
args.description:
(Optional) Whether the flavor is public. Changing this creates
a new flavor.

args.name: extra_specs
args.description: (Optional) Key/Value pairs of metadata for the flavor.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.
If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used.
Changing this creates a new flavor access.

args.name: flavor_id
args.description: (Required) The UUID of flavor to use. Changing this creates a new flavor access.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Required) The UUID of tenant which is allowed to use the flavor.
Changing this creates a new flavor access.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.
A Compute client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with
a compute instance. If omitted, the region argument of the provider
is used. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which may or may not
have a different address).

args.name: pool
args.description:
(Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating
IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.

attrs.name: address
attrs.description: The actual floating IP address itself.

attrs.name: fixed_ip
attrs.description: The fixed IP address corresponding to the floating IP.

attrs.name: instance_id
attrs.description: UUID of the compute instance associated with the floating IP.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.
Keypairs are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to
create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used.
Changing this creates a new floatingip_associate.

args.name: floating_ip
args.description: (Required) The floating IP to associate.

args.name: instance_id
args.description: (Required) The instance to associte the floating IP with.

args.name: fixed_ip
args.description: (Optional) The specific IP address to direct traffic to.

args.name: wait_until_associated
args.description:
(Optional) In cases where the OpenStack environment
does not automatically wait until the association has finished, set this
option to have Terraform poll the instance until the floating IP has been
associated. Defaults to false.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to create the server instance. If
omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new server.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) A unique name for the resource.

args.name: image_id
args.description:
(Optional; Required if image_name is empty and not booting
from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The image ID of
the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: image_name
args.description:
(Optional; Required if image_id is empty and not booting
from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The name of the
desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: flavor_id
args.description:
(Optional; Required if flavor_name is empty) The flavor ID of
the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

args.name: flavor_name
args.description:
(Optional; Required if flavor_id is empty) The name of the
desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.

args.name: user_data
args.description:
(Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.
Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: security_groups
args.description:
(Optional) An array of one or more security group names
to associate with the server. Changing this results in adding/removing
security groups from the existing server. Note: When attaching the
instance to networks using Ports, place the security groups on the Port
and not the instance.

args.name: availability_zone
args.description:
(Optional) The availability zone in which to create
the server. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: network
args.description:
(Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the
instance. The network object structure is documented below. Changing this
creates a new server.

args.name: uuid
args.description:
(Required unless port  or name is provided) The network UUID to
attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required unless uuid or port is provided) The human-readable
name of the network. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: port
args.description:
(Required unless uuid or name is provided) The port UUID of a
network to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: fixed_ip_v4
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv4 address to be used on this
network. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: access_network
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies if this network should be used for
provisioning access. Accepts true or false. Defaults to false.

args.name: metadata
args.description:
(Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from
within the instance. Changing this updates the existing server metadata.

args.name: config_drive
args.description:
(Optional) Whether to use the config_drive feature to
configure the instance. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: admin_pass
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative password to assign to the server.
Changing this changes the root password on the existing server.

args.name: key_pair
args.description:
(Optional) The name of a key pair to put on the server. The key
pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account.
Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: block_device
args.description:
(Optional) Configuration of block devices. The block_device
structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server.
You can specify multiple block devices which will create an instance with
multiple disks. This configuration is very flexible, so please see the
following reference
for more information.

args.name: uuid
args.description:
(Required unless source_type is set to "blank" ) The UUID of
the image, volume, or snapshot. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: source_type
args.description:
(Required) The source type of the device. Must be one of
"blank", "image", "volume", or "snapshot". Changing this creates a new
server.

args.name: volume_size
args.description:
The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Required
in the following combinations: source=image and destination=volume,
source=blank and destination=local, and source=blank and destination=volume.
Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: boot_index
args.description:
(Optional) The boot index of the volume. It defaults to 0.
Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: destination_type
args.description:
(Optional) The type that gets created. Possible values
are "volume" and "local". Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: delete_on_termination
args.description:
(Optional) Delete the volume / block device upon
termination of the instance. Defaults to false. Changing this creates a
new server.

args.name: device_type
args.description:
(Optional) The low-level device type that will be used. Most
common thing is to leave this empty. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: disk_bus
args.description:
(Optional) The low-level disk bus that will be used. Most common
thing is to leave this empty. Changing this creates a new server.

args.name: scheduler_hints
args.description:
(Optional) Provide the Nova scheduler with hints on how
the instance should be launched. The available hints are described below.

args.name: group
args.description:
(Optional) A UUID of a Server Group. The instance will be placed
into that group.

args.name: different_host
args.description:
(Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will
be scheduled on a different host than all other instances.

args.name: same_host
args.description:
(Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be
scheduled on the same host of those specified.

args.name: query
args.description:
(Optional) A conditional query that a compute node must pass in
order to host an instance.

args.name: target_cell
args.description: (Optional) The name of a cell to host the instance.

args.name: build_near_host_ip
args.description:
(Optional) An IP Address in CIDR form. The instance
will be placed on a compute node that is in the same subnet.

args.name: additional_properties
args.description:
(Optional) Arbitrary key/value pairs of additional
properties to pass to the scheduler.

args.name: personality
args.description:
(Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by
defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure
is described below.

args.name: file
args.description: (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.

args.name: content
args.description: (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.

args.name: stop_before_destroy
args.description:
(Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully
before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly.
If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.

args.name: force_delete
args.description:
(Optional) Whether to force the OpenStack instance to be
forcefully deleted. This is useful for environments that have reclaim / soft
deletion enabled.

args.name: power_state
args.description:
(Optional) Provide the VM state. Only 'active' and 'shutoff'
are supported values. Note: If the initial power_state is the shutoff
the VM will be stopped immediately after build and the provisioners like
remote-exec or files are not supported.

args.name: vendor_options
args.description:
(Optional) Map of additional vendor-specific options.
Supported options are described below.

args.name: ignore_resize_confirmation
args.description:
(Optional) Boolean to control whether
to ignore manual confirmation of the instance resizing. This can be helpful
to work with some OpenStack clouds which automatically confirm resizing of
instances after some timeout.

attrs.name: access_ip_v4
attrs.description: The first detected Fixed IPv4 address.

attrs.name: access_ip_v6
attrs.description: The first detected Fixed IPv6 address.

attrs.name: all_metadata
attrs.description:
Contains all instance metadata, even metadata not set
by Terraform.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to create the interface attachment.
If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new attachment.

args.name: instance_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the Instance to attach the Port or Network to.

args.name: port_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID of the Port to attach to an Instance.
NOTE: This option and network_id are mutually exclusive.

args.name: network_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID of the Network to attach to an Instance. A port will be created automatically.
NOTE: This option and port_id are mutually exclusive.

args.name: fixed_ip
args.description:
(Optional) An IP address to assosciate with the port.
NOTE: This option cannot be used with port_id. You must specifiy a network_id. The IP address must lie in a range on the supplied network.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.
Keypairs are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to
create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used.
Changing this creates a new keypair.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) A unique name for the keypair. Changing this creates a new
keypair.

args.name: public_key
args.description:
(Optional) A pregenerated OpenSSH-formatted public key.
Changing this creates a new keypair. If a public key is not specified, then
a public/private key pair will be automatically generated. If a pair is
created, then destroying this resource means you will lose access to that
keypair forever.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

attrs.name: fingerprint
attrs.description: The fingerprint of the public key.

attrs.name: private_key
attrs.description: The generated private key when no public key is specified.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.
A Compute client is needed to create a security group. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
security group.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) A unique name for the security group. Changing this
updates the name of an existing security group.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Required) A description for the security group. Changing this
updates the description of an existing security group.

args.name: rule
args.description:
(Optional) A rule describing how the security group operates. The
rule object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the
security group rules. As shown in the example above, multiple rule blocks
may be used.

args.name: from_port
args.description:
(Required) An integer representing the lower bound of the port
range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

args.name: to_port
args.description:
(Required) An integer representing the upper bound of the port
range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

args.name: ip_protocol
args.description:
(Required) The protocol type that will be allowed. Changing
this creates a new security group rule.

args.name: cidr
args.description:
(Optional) Required if from_group_id or self is empty. The IP range
that will be the source of network traffic to the security group. Use 0.0.0.0/0
to allow all IP addresses. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot
be combined with from_group_id or self.

args.name: from_group_id
args.description:
(Optional) Required if cidr or self is empty. The ID of a
group from which to forward traffic to the parent group. Changing this creates a
new security group rule. Cannot be combined with cidr or self.

args.name: self
args.description:
(Optional) Required if cidr and from_group_id is empty. If true,
the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot
be combined with cidr or from_group_id.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.
If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing
this creates a new server group.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) A unique name for the server group. Changing this creates
a new server group.

args.name: policies
args.description:
(Required) The set of policies for the server group. All policies
are mutually exclusive. See the Policies section for more information.
Changing this creates a new server group.

args.name: affinity
args.description:
All instances/servers launched in this group will be hosted on
the same compute node.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

attrs.name: members
attrs.description: The instances that are part of this server group.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.
A Compute client is needed to create a volume attachment. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a
new volume attachment.

args.name: instance_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the Instance to attach the Volume to.

args.name: volume_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the Volume to attach to an Instance.

args.name: device
args.description:
(Optional) The device of the volume attachment (ex: /dev/vdc).
NOTE: Being able to specify a device is dependent upon the hypervisor in
use. There is a chance that the device specified in Terraform will not be
the same device the hypervisor chose. If this happens, Terraform will wish
to update the device upon subsequent applying which will cause the volume
to be detached and reattached indefinitely. Please use with caution.

args.name: multiattach
args.description: (Optional) Enable attachment of multiattach-capable volumes.

attrs.name: device
attrs.description:
See Argument Reference above. NOTE: The correctness of this
information is dependent upon the hypervisor in use. In some cases, this
should not be used as an authoritative piece of information.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V1 Container Infra
client. A Container Infra client is needed to create a cluster. If omitted,
the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
cluster.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the cluster. Changing this updates the name
of the existing cluster template.

args.name: project_id
args.description:
(Optional) The project of the cluster. Required if admin wants
to create a cluster in another project. Changing this creates a new
cluster.

args.name: user_id
args.description:
(Optional) The user of the cluster. Required if admin wants to
create a cluster template for another user. Changing this creates a new
cluster.

args.name: cluster_template_id
args.description:
(Required) The UUID of the V1 Container Infra cluster
template. Changing this creates a new cluster.

args.name: create_timeout
args.description:
(Optional) The timeout (in minutes) for creating the
cluster. Changing this creates a new cluster.

args.name: discovery_url
args.description:
(Optional) The URL used for cluster node discovery.
Changing this creates a new cluster.

args.name: docker_volume_size
args.description:
(Optional) The size (in GB) of the Docker volume.
Changing this creates a new cluster.

args.name: flavor
args.description:
(Optional) The flavor for the nodes of the cluster. Can be set via
the OS_MAGNUM_FLAVOR environment variable. Changing this creates a new
cluster.

args.name: master_flavor
args.description:
(Optional) The flavor for the master nodes. Can be set via
the OS_MAGNUM_MASTER_FLAVOR environment variable. Changing this creates a
new cluster.

args.name: keypair
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the Compute service SSH keypair. Changing
this creates a new cluster.

args.name: labels
args.description:
(Optional) The list of key value pairs representing additional
properties of the cluster. Changing this creates a new cluster.

args.name: master_count
args.description:
(Optional) The number of master nodes for the cluster.
Changing this creates a new cluster.

args.name: node_count
args.description:
(Optional) The number of nodes for the cluster. Changing this
creates a new cluster.

attrs.name: created_at
attrs.description: The time at which cluster was created.

attrs.name: updated_at
attrs.description: The time at which cluster was created.

attrs.name: master_addresses
attrs.description: IP addresses of the master node of the cluster.

attrs.name: node_addresses
attrs.description: IP addresses of the node of the cluster.

attrs.name: stack_id
attrs.description: UUID of the Orchestration service stack.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V1 Container Infra
client. A Container Infra client is needed to create a cluster template. If
omitted,the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new cluster template.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the cluster template. Changing this updates
the name of the existing cluster template.

args.name: project_id
args.description:
(Optional) The project of the cluster template. Required if
admin wants to create a cluster template in another project. Changing this
creates a new cluster template.

args.name: user_id
args.description:
(Optional) The user of the cluster template. Required if admin
wants to create a cluster template for another user. Changing this creates
a new cluster template.

args.name: apiserver_port
args.description:
(Optional) The API server port for the Container
Orchestration Engine for this cluster template. Changing this updates the
API server port of the existing cluster template.

args.name: coe
args.description:
(Required) The Container Orchestration Engine for this cluster
template. Changing this updates the engine of the existing cluster
template.

args.name: cluster_distro
args.description:
(Optional) The distro for the cluster (fedora-atomic,
coreos, etc.). Changing this updates the cluster distro of the existing
cluster template.

args.name: dns_nameserver
args.description:
(Optional) Address of the DNS nameserver that is used in
nodes of the cluster. Changing this updates the DNS nameserver of the
existing cluster template.

args.name: docker_storage_driver
args.description:
(Optional) Docker storage driver. Changing this
updates the Docker storage driver of the existing cluster template.

args.name: docker_volume_size
args.description:
(Optional) The size (in GB) of the Docker volume.
Changing this updates the Docker volume size of the existing cluster
template.

args.name: external_network_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID of the external network that will
be used for the cluster. Changing this updates the external network ID of
the existing cluster template.

args.name: fixed_network
args.description:
(Optional) The fixed network that will be attached to the
cluster. Changing this updates the fixed network of the existing cluster
template.

args.name: fixed_subnet
args.description:
(Optional) The fixed subnet that will be attached to the
cluster. Changing this updates the fixed subnet of the existing cluster
template.

args.name: flavor
args.description:
(Optional) The flavor for the nodes of the cluster. Can be set via
the OS_MAGNUM_FLAVOR environment variable. Changing this updates the
flavor of the existing cluster template.

args.name: master_flavor
args.description:
(Optional) The flavor for the master nodes. Can be set via
the OS_MAGNUM_MASTER_FLAVOR environment variable. Changing this updates
the master flavor of the existing cluster template.

args.name: floating_ip_enabled
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether created cluster should
create floating IP for every node or not. Changing this updates the
floating IP enabled attribute of the existing cluster template.

args.name: http_proxy
args.description:
(Optional) The address of a proxy for receiving all HTTP
requests and relay them. Changing this updates the HTTP proxy address of
the existing cluster template.

args.name: https_proxy
args.description:
(Optional) The address of a proxy for receiving all HTTPS
requests and relay them. Changing this updates the HTTPS proxy address of
the existing cluster template.

args.name: image
args.description:
(Required) The reference to an image that is used for nodes of the
cluster. Can be set via the OS_MAGNUM_IMAGE environment variable.
Changing this updates the image attribute of the existing cluster template.

args.name: insecure_registry
args.description:
(Optional) The insecure registry URL for the cluster
template. Changing this updates the insecure registry attribute of the
existing cluster template.

args.name: keypair_id
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the Compute service SSH keypair.
Changing this updates the keypair of the existing cluster template.

args.name: labels
args.description:
(Optional) The list of key value pairs representing additional
properties of the cluster template. Changing this updates the labels of the
existing cluster template.

args.name: master_lb_enabled
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether created cluster should
has a loadbalancer for master nodes or not. Changing this updates the
attribute of the existing cluster template.

args.name: network_driver
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the driver for the container
network. Changing this updates the network driver of the existing cluster
template.

args.name: no_proxy
args.description:
(Optional) A comma-separated list of IP addresses that shouldn't
be used in the cluster. Changing this updates the no proxy list of the
existing cluster template.

args.name: public
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether cluster template should be public.
Changing this updates the public attribute of the existing cluster
template.

args.name: registry_enabled
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether Docker registry is enabled
in the cluster. Changing this updates the registry enabled attribute of the
existing cluster template.

args.name: server_type
args.description:
(Optional) The server type for the cluster template. Changing
this updates the server type of the existing cluster template.

args.name: tls_disabled
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether the TLS should be disabled in
the cluster. Changing this updates the attribute of the existing cluster.

args.name: volume_driver
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the driver that is used for the
volumes of the cluster nodes. Changing this updates the volume driver of
the existing cluster template.

attrs.name: created_at
attrs.description: The time at which cluster template was created.

attrs.name: updated_at
attrs.description: The time at which cluster template was created.

attrs.name: links
attrs.description: A list containing associated cluster template links.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Required) The region in which to create the db instance. Changing this
creates a new instance.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) A unique name for the resource.

args.name: flavor_id
args.description:
(Required) The flavor ID of the desired flavor for the instance.
Changing this creates new instance.

args.name: configuration_id
args.description:
(Optional) Configuration ID to be attached to the instance. Database instance
will be rebooted when configuration is detached.

args.name: size
args.description: (Required) Specifies the volume size in GB. Changing this creates new instance.

args.name: datastore
args.description:
(Required) An array of database engine type and version. The datastore
object structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new instance.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Required) Database engine type to be used in new instance. Changing this
creates a new instance.

args.name: version
args.description:
(Required) Version of database engine type to be used in new instance.
Changing this creates a new instance.

args.name: network
args.description:
(Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the
instance. The network object structure is documented below. Changing this
creates a new instance.

args.name: uuid
args.description:
(Required unless port is provided) The network UUID to
attach to the instance. Changing this creates a new instance.

args.name: port
args.description:
(Required unless uuid is provided) The port UUID of a
network to attach to the instance. Changing this creates a new instance.

args.name: fixed_ip_v4
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv4 address to be used on this
network. Changing this creates a new instance.

args.name: fixed_ip_v6
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies a fixed IPv6 address to be used on this
network. Changing this creates a new instance.

args.name: user
args.description:
(Optional) An array of username, password, host and databases. The user
object structure is documented below.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) Username to be created on new instance. Changing this creates a
new instance.

args.name: password
args.description:
(Optional) User's password. Changing this creates a
new instance.

args.name: host
args.description:
(Optional) An ip address or % sign indicating what ip addresses can connect with
this user credentials. Changing this creates a new instance.

args.name: databases
args.description:
(Optional) A list of databases that user will have access to. If not specified, 
 user has access to all databases on th einstance. Changing this creates a new instance.

args.name: database
args.description:
(Optional) An array of database name, charset and collate. The database
object structure is documented below.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) Database to be created on new instance. Changing this creates a
new instance.

args.name: collate
args.description: (Optional) Database collation. Changing this creates a new instance.

args.name: charset
args.description:
(Optional) Database character set. Changing this creates a
new instance.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) A unique name for the resource.

args.name: instance_id
args.description: (Required) The ID for the database instance.

attrs.name: region
attrs.description: Openstack region resource is created in.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) A unique name for the resource.

args.name: instance
args.description: (Required) The ID for the database instance.

args.name: password
args.description: (Required) User's password.

args.name: databases
args.description: (Optional) A list of database user should have access to.

attrs.name: region
attrs.description: Openstack region resource is created in.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Required) The region in which to create the db instance. Changing this
creates a new instance.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) A unique name for the resource.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Description of the resource.

args.name: datastore
args.description:
(Required) An array of database engine type and version. The datastore
object structure is documented below. Changing this creates resource.

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) Database engine type to be used with this configuration. Changing this creates a new resource.

args.name: version
args.description: (Required) Version of database engine type to be used with this configuration. Changing this creates a new resource.

args.name: configuration
args.description: (Optional) An array of configuration parameter name and value. Can be specified multiple times. The configuration object structure is documented below.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) Configuration parameter name. Changing this creates a new resource.

args.name: value
args.description: (Optional) Configuration parameter value. Changing this creates a new resource.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 DNS client.
If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used.
Changing this creates a new DNS  record set.

args.name: zone_id
args.description:
(Required) The ID of the zone in which to create the record set.
Changing this creates a new DNS  record set.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the record set. Note the . at the end of the name.
Changing this creates a new DNS  record set.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Optional) The type of record set. Examples: "A", "MX".
Changing this creates a new DNS  record set.

args.name: ttl
args.description: (Optional) The time to live (TTL) of the record set.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) A description of the  record set.

args.name: records
args.description:
(Optional) An array of DNS records. Note: if an IPv6 address
contains brackets ([ ]), the brackets will be stripped and the modified
address will be recorded in the state.

args.name: value_specs
args.description:
(Optional) Map of additional options. Changing this creates a
new record set.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.
Keypairs are associated with accounts, but a Compute client is needed to
create one. If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used.
Changing this creates a new DNS zone.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the zone. Note the . at the end of the name.
Changing this creates a new DNS zone.

args.name: email
args.description: (Optional) The email contact for the zone record.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Optional) The type of zone. Can either be PRIMARY or SECONDARY.
Changing this creates a new zone.

args.name: attributes
args.description:
(Optional) Attributes for the DNS Service scheduler.
Changing this creates a new zone.

args.name: ttl
args.description: (Optional) The time to live (TTL) of the zone.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) A description of the zone.

args.name: masters
args.description:
(Optional) An array of master DNS servers. For when type is
SECONDARY.

args.name: value_specs
args.description:
(Optional) Map of additional options. Changing this creates a
new zone.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client.
If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new application credential.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) A name of the application credential. Changing this
creates a new application credential.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) A description of the application credential.
Changing this creates a new application credential.

args.name: unrestricted
args.description:
(Optional) A flag indicating whether the application
credential may be used for creation or destruction of other application
credentials or trusts. Changing this creates a new application credential.

args.name: secret
args.description:
(Optional) The secret for the application credential. If omitted,
it will be generated by the server. Changing this creates a new application
credential.

args.name: roles
args.description:
(Optional) A collection of one or more role names, which this
application credential has to be associated with its project. If omitted,
all the current user's roles within the scoped project will be inherited by
a new application credential. Changing this creates a new application
credential.

args.name: expires_at
args.description:
(Optional) The expiration time of the application credential
in the RFC3339 timestamp format (e.g. 2019-03-09T12:58:49Z). If omitted,
an application credential will never expire. Changing this creates a new
application credential.

attrs.name: project_id
attrs.description:
The ID of the project the application credential was created
for and that authentication requests using this application credential will
be scoped to.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) A description of the project.

args.name: domain_id
args.description: (Optional) The domain this project belongs to.

args.name: enabled
args.description:
(Optional) Whether the project is enabled or disabled. Valid
values are true and false.

args.name: is_domain
args.description:
(Optional) Whether this project is a domain. Valid values
are true and false.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) The name of the project.

args.name: parent_id
args.description: (Optional) The parent of this project.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client.
If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new User.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the role.

args.name: domain_id
args.description: (Optional) The domain the role belongs to.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client.
If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new Role.

args.name: domain_id
args.description: (Optional; Required if project_id is empty) The domain to assign the role in.

args.name: group_id
args.description: (Optional; Required if user_id is empty) The group to assign the role to.

args.name: project_id
args.description: (Optional; Required if domain_id is empty) The project to assign the role in.

args.name: user_id
args.description: (Optional; Required if group_id is empty) The user to assign the role to.

args.name: role_id
args.description: (Required) The role to assign.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) A description of the user.

args.name: default_project_id
args.description: (Optional) The default project this user belongs to.

args.name: domain_id
args.description: (Optional) The domain this user belongs to.

args.name: enabled
args.description:
(Optional) Whether the user is enabled or disabled. Valid
values are true and false.

args.name: extra
args.description: (Optional) Free-form key/value pairs of extra information.

args.name: ignore_change_password_upon_first_use
args.description:
(Optional) User will not have to
change their password upon first use. Valid values are true and false.

args.name: ignore_password_expiry
args.description:
(Optional) User's password will not expire.
Valid values are true and false.

args.name: ignore_lockout_failure_attempts
args.description:
(Optional) User will not have a failure
lockout placed on their account. Valid values are true and false.

args.name: multi_factor_auth_enabled
args.description:
(Optional) Whether to enable multi-factor
authentication. Valid values are true and false.

args.name: multi_factor_auth_rule
args.description:
(Optional) A multi-factor authentication rule.
The structure is documented below. Please see the
Ocata release notes
for more information on how to use mulit-factor rules.

args.name: rule
args.description:
(Required) A list of authentication plugins that the user must
authenticate with.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) The name of the user.

args.name: password
args.description: (Optional) The password for the user.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V3 Keystone client.
If omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new User.

args.name: container_format
args.description:
(Required) The container format. Must be one of
"ami", "ari", "aki", "bare", "ovf".

args.name: disk_format
args.description:
(Required) The disk format. Must be one of
"ami", "ari", "aki", "vhd", "vmdk", "raw", "qcow2", "vdi", "iso".

args.name: local_file_path
args.description:
(Optional) This is the filepath of the raw image file
that will be uploaded to Glance. Conflicts with image_source_url.

args.name: image_cache_path
args.description:
(Optional) This is the directory where the images will
be downloaded. Images will be stored with a filename corresponding to
the url's md5 hash. Defaults to "$HOME/.terraform/image_cache"

args.name: image_source_url
args.description:
(Optional) This is the url of the raw image that will
be downloaded in the image_cache_path before being uploaded to Glance.
Glance is able to download image from internet but the gophercloud library
does not yet provide a way to do so.
Conflicts with local_file_path.

args.name: min_disk_gb
args.description:
(Optional) Amount of disk space (in GB) required to boot image.
Defaults to 0.

args.name: min_ram_mb
args.description:
(Optional) Amount of ram (in MB) required to boot image.
Defauts to 0.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) The name of the image.

args.name: properties
args.description:
(Optional) A map of key/value pairs to set freeform
information about an image. See the "Notes" section for further
information about properties.

args.name: protected
args.description:
(Optional) If true, image will not be deletable.
Defaults to false.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Glance client.
A Glance client is needed to create an Image that can be used with
a compute instance. If omitted, the region argument of the provider
is used. Changing this creates a new Image.

args.name: tags
args.description:
(Optional) The tags of the image. It must be a list of strings.
At this time, it is not possible to delete all tags of an image.

args.name: verify_checksum
args.description:
(Optional) If false, the checksum will not be verified
once the image is finished uploading. Defaults to true.

args.name: visibility
args.description:
(Optional) The visibility of the image. Must be one of
"public", "private", "community", or "shared". The ability to set the
visibility depends upon the configuration of the OpenStack cloud.

attrs.name: checksum
attrs.description: The checksum of the data associated with the image.

attrs.name: created_at
attrs.description: The date the image was created.

attrs.name: file
attrs.description:
the trailing path after the glance
endpoint that represent the location of the image
or the path to retrieve it.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: A unique ID assigned by Glance.

attrs.name: metadata
attrs.description:
The metadata associated with the image.
Image metadata allow for meaningfully define the image properties
and tags. See https://docs.openstack.org/glance/latest/user/metadefs-concepts.html.

attrs.name: owner
attrs.description: The id of the openstack user who owns the image.

attrs.name: schema
attrs.description:
The path to the JSON-schema that represent
the image or image

attrs.name: size_bytes
attrs.description: The size in bytes of the data associated with the image.

attrs.name: status
attrs.description:
The status of the image. It can be "queued", "active"
or "saving".

attrs.name: updated_at
attrs.description: The date the image was last updated.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron address-scope. If omitted,
the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
address-scope.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the address-scope. Changing this updates the
name of the existing address-scope.

args.name: ip_version
args.description:
(Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this
creates a new address-scope.

args.name: shared
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether this address-scope is shared across
all projects. Changing this updates the shared status of the existing
address-scope.

args.name: project_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the address-scope. Required if admin
wants to create a address-scope for another project. Changing this creates a
new address-scope.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with
another networking resource, such as a load balancer. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable description for the floating IP.

args.name: pool
args.description:
(Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating
IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.

args.name: port_id
args.description:
(Optional) ID of an existing port with at least one IP address to
associate with this floating IP.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The target tenant ID in which to allocate the floating
IP, if you specify this together with a port_id, make sure the target port
belongs to the same tenant. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which
may or may not have a different address)

args.name: address
args.description:
(Optional) The actual/specific floating IP to obtain. By default,
non-admin users are not able to specify a floating IP, so you must either be 
an admin user or have had a custom policy or role applied to your OpenStack 
user or project.

args.name: fixed_ip
args.description:
Fixed IP of the port to associate with this floating IP. Required if
the port has multiple fixed IPs.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description:
(Optional) The subnet ID of the floating IP pool. Specify this if
the floating IP network has multiple subnets.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A set of string tags for the floating IP.

args.name: dns_name
args.description:
(Optional) The floating IP DNS name. Available, when Neutron DNS
extension is enabled. The data in this attribute will be published in an
external DNS service when Neutron is configured to integrate with such a
service. Changing this creates a new floating IP.

args.name: dns_domain
args.description:
(Optional) The floating IP DNS domain. Available, when Neutron
DNS extension is enabled. The data in this attribute will be published in an
external DNS service when Neutron is configured to integrate with such a
service. Changing this creates a new floating IP.

attrs.name: address
attrs.description: The actual floating IP address itself.

attrs.name: tenant_id
attrs.description: the ID of the tenant in which to create the floating IP.

attrs.name: fixed_ip
attrs.description: The fixed IP which the floating IP maps to.

attrs.name: all_tags
attrs.description:
The collection of tags assigned on the floating IP, which have
been explicitly and implicitly added.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with
another networking resource, such as a load balancer. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).

args.name: floating_ip
args.description: (Required) IP Address of an existing floating IP.

args.name: port_id
args.description:
(Required) ID of an existing port with at least one IP address to
associate with this floating IP.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron network. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
network.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the network. Changing this updates the name of
the existing network.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) Human-readable description of the network. Changing this
updates the name of the existing network.

args.name: shared
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies whether the network resource can be accessed
by any tenant or not. Changing this updates the sharing capabilities of the
existing network.

args.name: external
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies whether the network resource has the
external routing facility. Valid values are true and false. Defaults to
false. Changing this updates the external attribute of the existing network.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the network. Required if admin wants to
create a network for another tenant. Changing this creates a new network.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the network.
Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the
state of the existing network.

args.name: segments
args.description: (Optional) An array of one or more provider segment objects.

args.name: physical_network
args.description: The physical network where this network is implemented.

args.name: segmentation_id
args.description: An isolated segment on the physical network.

args.name: network_type
args.description: The type of physical network.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

args.name: availability_zone_hints
args.description:
(Optional) An availability zone is used to make
network resources highly available. Used for resources with high availability
so that they are scheduled on different availability zones. Changing this
creates a new network.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A set of string tags for the network.

args.name: transparent_vlan
args.description:
(Optional) Specifies whether the network resource has the
VLAN transparent attribute set. Valid values are true and false. Defaults to
false. Changing this updates the transparent_vlan attribute of the existing
network.

args.name: port_security_enabled
args.description:
(Optional) Whether to explicitly enable or disable
port security on the network. Port Security is usually enabled by default, so
omitting this argument will usually result in a value of "true". Setting this
explicitly to false will disable port security. Valid values are true and
false.

args.name: mtu
args.description:
(Optional) The network MTU. Available for read-only, when Neutron
net-mtu extension is enabled. Available for the modification, when
Neutron net-mtu-writable extension is enabled.

args.name: dns_domain
args.description:
(Optional) The network DNS domain. Available, when Neutron DNS
extension is enabled. The dns_domain of a network in conjunction with the
dns_name attribute of its ports will be published in an external DNS
service when Neutron is configured to integrate with such a service.

attrs.name: all_tags
attrs.description:
The collection of tags assigned on the network, which have been
explicitly and implicitly added.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client.
A networking client is needed to create a port. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
port.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) A unique name for the port. Changing this
updates the name of an existing port.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) Human-readable description of the floating IP. Changing
this updates the description of an existing port.

args.name: network_id
args.description:
(Required) The ID of the network to attach the port to. Changing
this creates a new port.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) Administrative up/down status for the port
(must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the
admin_state_up of an existing port.

args.name: mac_address
args.description:
(Optional) Specify a specific MAC address for the port. Changing
this creates a new port.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the Port. Required if admin wants
to create a port for another tenant. Changing this creates a new port.

args.name: device_owner
args.description:
(Optional) The device owner of the Port. Changing this creates
a new port.

args.name: security_group_ids
args.description:
(Optional - Conflicts with no_security_groups) A list
of security group IDs to apply to the port. The security groups must be
specified by ID and not name (as opposed to how they are configured with
the Compute Instance).

args.name: no_security_groups
args.description:
(Optional - Conflicts with security_group_ids) If set to
true, then no security groups are applied to the port. If set to false and
no security_group_ids are specified, then the Port will yield to the default
behavior of the Networking service, which is to usually apply the "default"
security group.

args.name: device_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID of the device attached to the port. Changing this
creates a new port.

args.name: fixed_ip
args.description:
(Optional - Conflicts with no_fixed_ip) An array of desired IPs for
this port. The structure is described below.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description:
(Required) Subnet in which to allocate IP address for
this port.

args.name: ip_address
args.description:
(Optional) IP address desired in the subnet for this port. If
you don't specify ip_address, an available IP address from the specified
subnet will be allocated to this port. This field will not be populated if it
is left blank or omitted. To retrieve the assigned IP address, use the
all_fixed_ips attribute.

args.name: no_fixed_ip
args.description:
(Optional - Conflicts with fixed_ip) Create a port with no fixed
IP address. This will also remove any fixed IPs previously set on a port. true
is the only valid value for this argument.

args.name: allowed_address_pairs
args.description:
(Optional) An IP/MAC Address pair of additional IP
addresses that can be active on this port. The structure is described
below.

args.name: ip_address
args.description: (Required) The additional IP address.

args.name: mac_address
args.description: (Optional) The additional MAC address.

args.name: extra_dhcp_option
args.description:
(Optional) An extra DHCP option that needs to be configured
on the port. The structure is described below. Can be specified multiple
times.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) Name of the DHCP option.

args.name: value
args.description: (Required) Value of the DHCP option.

args.name: ip_version
args.description: (Optional) IP protocol version. Defaults to 4.

args.name: port_security_enabled
args.description:
(Optional) Whether to explicitly enable or disable
port security on the port. Port Security is usually enabled by default, so
omitting argument will usually result in a value of "true". Setting this
explicitly to false will disable port security. In order to disable port
security, the port must not have any security groups. Valid values are true
and false.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A set of string tags for the port.

args.name: binding
args.description:
(Optional) The port binding allows to specify binding information
for the port. The structure is described below.

args.name: host_id
args.description: (Optional) The ID of the host to allocate port on.

args.name: profile
args.description:
(Optional) Custom data to be passed as binding:profile. Data
must be passed as JSON.

args.name: vnic_type
args.description:
(Optional) VNIC type for the port. Can either be direct,
direct-physical, macvtap, normal, baremetal or virtio-forwarder.
Default value is normal.

args.name: vif_details
args.description:
(Computed) A map of JSON strings containing additional
details for this specific binding.

args.name: vif_type
args.description: (Computed) The VNIC type of the port binding.

args.name: dns_name
args.description:
(Optional) The port DNS name. Available, when Neutron DNS extension
is enabled.

attrs.name: all_fixed_ips
attrs.description:
The collection of Fixed IP addresses on the port in the
order returned by the Network v2 API.

attrs.name: all_security_group_ids
attrs.description:
The collection of Security Group IDs on the port
which have been explicitly and implicitly added.

attrs.name: all_tags
attrs.description:
The collection of tags assigned on the port, which have been
explicitly and implicitly added.

attrs.name: dns_assignment
attrs.description: The list of maps representing port DNS assignments.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client.
A networking client is needed to manage a port. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
resource.

args.name: port_id
args.description: (Required) An UUID of the port to apply security groups to.

args.name: security_group_ids
args.description:
(Required) A list of security group IDs to apply to
the port. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as
opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).

args.name: enforce
args.description:
(Optional) Whether to replace or append the list of security
groups, specified in the security_group_ids. Defaults to false.

attrs.name: all_security_group_ids
attrs.description:
The collection of Security Group IDs on the port
which have been explicitly and implicitly added.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client.
A networking client is needed to create a router. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
router interface.

args.name: router_id
args.description:
(Required) ID of the router this interface belongs to. Changing
this creates a new router interface.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description:
ID of the subnet this interface connects to. Changing
this creates a new router interface.

args.name: port_id
args.description:
ID of the port this interface connects to. Changing
this creates a new router interface.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client.
A networking client is needed to configure a routing entry on a router. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
routing entry.

args.name: router_id
args.description:
(Required) ID of the router this routing entry belongs to. Changing
this creates a new routing entry.

args.name: destination_cidr
args.description:
(Required) CIDR block to match on the packets destination IP. Changing
this creates a new routing entry.

args.name: next_hop
args.description:
(Required) IP address of the next hop gateway.  Changing
this creates a new routing entry.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client.
A networking client is needed to create a router. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
router.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) A unique name for the router. Changing this
updates the name of an existing router.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable description for the router.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) Administrative up/down status for the router
(must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the
admin_state_up of an existing router.

args.name: distributed
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether or not to create a
distributed router. The default policy setting in Neutron restricts
usage of this property to administrative users only.

args.name: external_gateway
args.description:
(Deprecated - use external_network_id instead) The
network UUID of an external gateway for the router. A router with an
external gateway is required if any compute instances or load balancers
will be using floating IPs. Changing this updates the external gateway
of an existing router.

args.name: external_network_id
args.description:
(Optional) The network UUID of an external gateway
for the router. A router with an external gateway is required if any
compute instances or load balancers will be using floating IPs. Changing
this updates the external gateway of the router.

args.name: enable_snat
args.description:
(Optional) Enable Source NAT for the router. Valid values are
"true" or "false". An external_network_id has to be set in order to
set this property. Changing this updates the enable_snat of the router.

args.name: external_fixed_ip
args.description:
(Optional) An external fixed IP for the router. This
can be repeated. The structure is described below. An external_network_id
has to be set in order to set this property. Changing this updates the
external fixed IPs of the router.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description: (Optional) Subnet in which the fixed IP belongs to.

args.name: ip_address
args.description: (Optional) The IP address to set on the router.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the floating IP. Required if admin wants
to create a router for another tenant. Changing this creates a new router.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional driver-specific options.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A set of string tags for the router.

args.name: vendor_options
args.description:
(Optional) Map of additional vendor-specific options.
Supported options are described below.

args.name: set_router_gateway_after_create
args.description:
(Optional) Boolean to control whether
the Router gateway is assigned during creation or updated after creation.

args.name: availability_zone_hints
args.description:
(Optional) An availability zone is used to make 
network resources highly available. Used for resources with high availability so that they are scheduled on different availability zones. Changing
this creates a new router.

attrs.name: all_tags
attrs.description:
The collection of tags assigned on the router, which have been
explicitly and implicitly added.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron subnet. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
subnet.

args.name: network_id
args.description:
(Required) The UUID of the parent network. Changing this
creates a new subnet.

args.name: cidr
args.description:
(Optional) CIDR representing IP range for this subnet, based on IP
version. You can omit this option if you are creating a subnet from a
subnet pool.

args.name: prefix_length
args.description:
(Optional) The prefix length to use when creating a subnet
from a subnet pool. The default subnet pool prefix length that was defined
when creating the subnet pool will be used if not provided. Changing this
creates a new subnet.

args.name: ip_version
args.description:
(Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this creates a
new subnet.

args.name: ipv6_address_mode
args.description:
(Optional) The IPv6 address mode. Valid values are
dhcpv6-stateful, dhcpv6-stateless, or slaac.

args.name: ipv6_ra_mode
args.description:
(Optional) The IPv6 Router Advertisement mode. Valid values
are dhcpv6-stateful, dhcpv6-stateless, or slaac.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the subnet. Changing this updates the name of
the existing subnet.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) Human-readable description of the subnet. Changing this
updates the name of the existing subnet.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the subnet. Required if admin wants to
create a subnet for another tenant. Changing this creates a new subnet.

args.name: allocation_pools
args.description:
(Deprecated - use allocation_pool instead)
An array of sub-ranges of CIDR available for dynamic allocation to ports.
The allocation_pools object structure is documented below.

args.name: start
args.description: (Required) The starting address.

args.name: end
args.description: (Required) The ending address.

args.name: allocation_pool
args.description:
(Optional) An array of sub-ranges of CIDR available for
dynamic allocation to ports. The allocation_pool object structure is
documented below.

args.name: start
args.description: (Required) The starting address.

args.name: end
args.description: (Required) The ending address.

args.name: gateway_ip
args.description:
(Optional)  Default gateway used by devices in this subnet.
Leaving this blank and not setting no_gateway will cause a default
gateway of .1 to be used. Changing this updates the gateway IP of the
existing subnet.

args.name: no_gateway
args.description:
(Optional) Do not set a gateway IP on this subnet. Changing
this removes or adds a default gateway IP of the existing subnet.

args.name: enable_dhcp
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the network.
Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value enables or
disables the DHCP capabilities of the existing subnet. Defaults to true.

args.name: dns_nameservers
args.description:
(Optional) An array of DNS name server names used by hosts
in this subnet. Changing this updates the DNS name servers for the existing
subnet.

args.name: host_routes
args.description:
(Deprecated - use openstack_networking_subnet_route_v2
instead) An array of routes that should be used by devices
with IPs from this subnet (not including local subnet route). The host_route
object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the host routes
for the existing subnet.

args.name: destination_cidr
args.description: (Required) The destination CIDR.

args.name: next_hop
args.description: (Required) The next hop in the route.

args.name: subnetpool_id
args.description: (Optional) The ID of the subnetpool associated with the subnet.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A set of string tags for the subnet.

attrs.name: all_tags
attrs.description:
The collection of ags assigned on the subnet, which have been
explicitly and implicitly added.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client.
A networking client is needed to configure a routing entry on a subnet. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
routing entry.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description:
(Required) ID of the subnet this routing entry belongs to. Changing
this creates a new routing entry.

args.name: destination_cidr
args.description:
(Required) CIDR block to match on the packets destination IP. Changing
this creates a new routing entry.

args.name: next_hop
