args.description:
(Required) IP address of the next hop gateway.  Changing
this creates a new routing entry.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron subnetpool. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
subnetpool.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the subnetpool. Changing this updates the name of
the existing subnetpool.

args.name: default_quota
args.description:
(Optional) The per-project quota on the prefix space that can be
allocated from the subnetpool for project subnets. Changing this updates the
default quota of the existing subnetpool.

args.name: project_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the subnetpool. Required if admin wants to
create a subnetpool for another project. Changing this creates a new subnetpool.

args.name: prefixes
args.description:
(Required) A list of subnet prefixes to assign to the subnetpool.
Neutron API merges adjacent prefixes and treats them as a single prefix. Each
subnet prefix must be unique among all subnet prefixes in all subnetpools that
are associated with the address scope. Changing this updates the prefixes list
of the existing subnetpool.

args.name: default_prefixlen
args.description:
(Optional) The size of the prefix to allocate when the cidr
or prefixlen attributes are omitted when you create the subnet. Defaults to the
MinPrefixLen. Changing this updates the default prefixlen of the existing
subnetpool.

args.name: min_prefixlen
args.description:
(Optional) The smallest prefix that can be allocated from a
subnetpool. For IPv4 subnetpools, default is 8. For IPv6 subnetpools, default
is 64. Changing this updates the min prefixlen of the existing subnetpool.

args.name: max_prefixlen
args.description:
(Optional) The maximum prefix size that can be allocated from
the subnetpool. For IPv4 subnetpools, default is 32. For IPv6 subnetpools,
default is 128. Changing this updates the max prefixlen of the existing
subnetpool.

args.name: address_scope_id
args.description:
(Optional) The Neutron address scope to assign to the
subnetpool. Changing this updates the address scope id of the existing
subnetpool.

args.name: shared
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether this subnetpool is shared across
all projects. Changing this updates the shared status of the existing
subnetpool.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) The human-readable description for the subnetpool.
Changing this updates the description of the existing subnetpool.

args.name: is_default
args.description:
(Optional) Indicates whether the subnetpool is default
subnetpool or not. Changing this updates the default status of the existing
subnetpool.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A set of string tags for the subnetpool.

attrs.name: created_at
attrs.description: The time at which subnetpool was created.

attrs.name: updated_at
attrs.description: The time at which subnetpool was created.

attrs.name: revision_number
attrs.description: The revision number of the subnetpool.

attrs.name: all_tags
attrs.description:
The collection of tags assigned on the subnetpool, which have been
explicitly and implicitly added.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client.
A networking client is needed to create a port. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
security group.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) A unique name for the security group.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) A unique name for the security group.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the security group. Required if admin
wants to create a port for another tenant. Changing this creates a new
security group.

args.name: delete_default_rules
args.description:
(Optional) Whether or not to delete the default
egress security rules. This is false by default. See the below note
for more information.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A set of string tags for the security group.

attrs.name: all_tags
attrs.description:
The collection of tags assigned on the security group, which have
been explicitly and implicitly added.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client.
A networking client is needed to create a port. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
security group rule.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) A description of the rule. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

args.name: direction
args.description:
(Required) The direction of the rule, valid values are ingress
or egress. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

args.name: ethertype
args.description:
(Required) The layer 3 protocol type, valid values are IPv4
or IPv6. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

args.name: protocol
args.description:
(Optional) The layer 4 protocol type, valid values are following. Changing this creates a new security group rule. This is required if you want to specify a port range.


tcp

udp

icmp

ah

dccp

egp

esp

gre

igmp

ipv6-encap

ipv6-frag

ipv6-icmp

ipv6-nonxt

ipv6-opts

ipv6-route

ospf

pgm

rsvp

sctp

udplite

vrrp

args.name: port_range_min
args.description:
(Optional) The lower part of the allowed port range, valid
integer value needs to be between 1 and 65535. Changing this creates a new
security group rule.

args.name: port_range_max
args.description:
(Optional) The higher part of the allowed port range, valid
integer value needs to be between 1 and 65535. Changing this creates a new
security group rule.

args.name: remote_ip_prefix
args.description:
(Optional) The remote CIDR, the value needs to be a valid
CIDR (i.e. 192.168.0.0/16). Changing this creates a new security group rule.

args.name: remote_group_id
args.description:
(Optional) The remote group id, the value needs to be an
Openstack ID of a security group in the same tenant. Changing this creates
a new security group rule.

args.name: security_group_id
args.description:
(Required) The security group id the rule should belong
to, the value needs to be an Openstack ID of a security group in the same
tenant. Changing this creates a new security group rule.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the security group. Required if admin
wants to create a port for another tenant. Changing this creates a new
security group rule.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 networking client.
A networking client is needed to create a trunk. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
trunk.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) A unique name for the trunk. Changing this
updates the name of an existing trunk.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) Human-readable description of the trunk. Changing this
updates the name of the existing trunk.

args.name: port_id
args.description:
(Required) The ID of the port to be used as the parent port of the
trunk. This is the port that should be used as the compute instance network
port. Changing this creates a new trunk.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) Administrative up/down status for the trunk
(must be "true" or "false" if provided). Changing this updates the
admin_state_up of an existing trunk.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the Trunk. Required if admin wants
to create a trunk on behalf of another tenant. Changing this creates a new trunk.

args.name: sub_port
args.description:
(Optional) The set of ports that will be made subports of the trunk.
The structure of each subport is described below.

args.name: port_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the port to be made a subport of the trunk.

args.name: segmentation_type
args.description: (Required) The segmentation technology to use, e.g., "vlan".

args.name: segmentation_id
args.description: (Required) The numeric id of the subport segment.

args.name: tags
args.description: (Optional) A set of string tags for the port.

attrs.name: all_tags
attrs.description:
The collection of tags assigned on the trunk, which have been
explicitly and implicitly added.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an LB member. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
LB member.

args.name: pool_id
args.description:
(Required)  The ID of the LB pool. Changing this creates a new
member.

args.name: address
args.description:
(Required) The IP address of the member. Changing this creates a
new member.

args.name: port
args.description:
(Required) An integer representing the port on which the member is
hosted. Changing this creates a new member.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the member.
Acceptable values are 'true' and 'false'. Changing this value updates the
state of the existing member.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the member. Required if admin wants to
create a member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new member.

attrs.name: weight
attrs.description:
The load balancing weight of the member. This is currently unable
to be set through Terraform.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an LB monitor. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
LB monitor.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Required) The type of probe, which is PING, TCP, HTTP, or HTTPS,
that is sent by the monitor to verify the member state. Changing this
creates a new monitor.

args.name: delay
args.description:
(Required) The time, in seconds, between sending probes to members.
Changing this creates a new monitor.

args.name: timeout
args.description:
(Required) Maximum number of seconds for a monitor to wait for a
ping reply before it times out. The value must be less than the delay value.
Changing this updates the timeout of the existing monitor.

args.name: max_retries
args.description:
(Required) Number of permissible ping failures before changing
the member's status to INACTIVE. Must be a number between 1 and 10. Changing
this updates the max_retries of the existing monitor.

args.name: url_path
args.description:
(Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. URI path that will be
accessed if monitor type is HTTP or HTTPS. Changing this updates the
url_path of the existing monitor.

args.name: http_method
args.description:
(Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. The HTTP method used
for requests by the monitor. If this attribute is not specified, it defaults
to "GET". Changing this updates the http_method of the existing monitor.

args.name: expected_codes
args.description:
(Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. Expected HTTP codes
for a passing HTTP(S) monitor. You can either specify a single status like
"200", or a range like "200-202". Changing this updates the expected_codes
of the existing monitor.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the monitor.
Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the
state of the existing monitor.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the monitor. Required if admin wants to
create a monitor for another tenant. Changing this creates a new monitor.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an LB pool. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
LB pool.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the pool. Changing this updates the name of
the existing pool.

args.name: protocol
args.description:
(Required)  The protocol used by the pool members, you can use
either 'TCP, 'HTTP', or 'HTTPS'. Changing this creates a new pool.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description:
(Required) The network on which the members of the pool will be
located. Only members that are on this network can be added to the pool.
Changing this creates a new pool.

args.name: lb_method
args.description:
(Required) The algorithm used to distribute load between the
members of the pool. The current specification supports 'ROUND_ROBIN' and
'LEAST_CONNECTIONS' as valid values for this attribute.

args.name: lb_provider
args.description:
(Optional) The backend load balancing provider. For example:
haproxy, F5, etc.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the pool. Required if admin wants to
create a pool member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new pool.

args.name: monitor_ids
args.description:
(Optional) A list of IDs of monitors to associate with the
pool.

args.name: member
args.description:
(Optional) An existing node to add to the pool. Changing this
updates the members of the pool. The member object structure is documented
below. Please note that the member block is deprecated in favor of the
openstack_lb_member_v1 resource.

args.name: address
args.description:
(Required) The IP address of the member. Changing this creates a
new member.

args.name: port
args.description:
(Required) An integer representing the port on which the member is
hosted. Changing this creates a new member.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Required) The administrative state of the member.
Acceptable values are 'true' and 'false'. Changing this value updates the
state of the existing member.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the member. Required if admin wants to
create a pool member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new member.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a VIP. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
VIP.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) The name of the vip. Changing this updates the name of
the existing vip.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description:
(Required) The network on which to allocate the vip's address. A
tenant can only create vips on networks authorized by policy (e.g. networks
that belong to them or networks that are shared). Changing this creates a
new vip.

args.name: protocol
args.description:
(Required)  The protocol - can be either 'TCP, 'HTTP', or
HTTPS'. Changing this creates a new vip.

args.name: port
args.description:
(Required) The port on which to listen for client traffic. Changing
this creates a new vip.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Required) The type of persistence mode. Valid values are "SOURCE_IP",
"HTTP_COOKIE", or "APP_COOKIE".

args.name: cookie_name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the cookie if persistence mode is set
appropriately.

args.name: pool_id
args.description:
(Required) The ID of the pool with which the vip is associated.
Changing this updates the pool_id of the existing vip.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the vip. Required if admin wants to
create a vip member for another tenant. Changing this creates a new vip.

args.name: address
args.description:
(Optional)  The IP address of the vip. Changing this creates a new
vip.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) Human-readable description for the vip. Changing
this updates the description of the existing vip.

args.name: persistence
args.description:
(Optional) Omit this field to prevent session persistence.
The persistence object structure is documented below. Changing this updates
the persistence of the existing vip.

args.name: conn_limit
args.description:
(Optional) The maximum number of connections allowed for the
vip. Default is -1, meaning no limit. Changing this updates the conn_limit
of the existing vip.

args.name: floating_ip
args.description:
(Optional) A Networking Floating IP that will be associated
with the vip. The Floating IP must be provisioned already.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the vip.
Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value updates the
state of the existing vip.

attrs.name: port_id
attrs.description: Port UUID for this VIP at associated floating IP (if any).

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an LB member. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
LB member.

args.name: vip_subnet_id
args.description:
(Required) The network on which to allocate the
Loadbalancer's address. A tenant can only create Loadbalancers on networks
authorized by policy (e.g. networks that belong to them or networks that
are shared).  Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) Human-readable name for the Loadbalancer. Does not have
to be unique.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable description for the Loadbalancer.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns
the Loadbalancer.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own.  Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.

args.name: vip_address
args.description:
(Optional) The ip address of the load balancer.
Changing this creates a new loadbalancer.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the Loadbalancer.
A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).

args.name: flavor
args.description:
(Optional) The UUID of a flavor. Changing this creates a new
loadbalancer.

args.name: loadbalancer_provider
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the provider. Changing this
creates a new loadbalancer.

args.name: security_group_ids
args.description:
(Optional) A list of security group IDs to apply to the
loadbalancer. The security groups must be specified by ID and not name (as
opposed to how they are configured with the Compute Instance).

attrs.name: vip_port_id
attrs.description: The Port ID of the Load Balancer IP.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
Listener.

args.name: protocol
args.description:
(Required) The protocol - can either be TCP, HTTP, HTTPS or TERMINATED_HTTPS.
Changing this creates a new Listener.

args.name: protocol_port
args.description:
(Required) The port on which to listen for client traffic.
Changing this creates a new Listener.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns
the Listener.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own. Changing this creates a new Listener.

args.name: loadbalancer_id
args.description:
(Required) The load balancer on which to provision this
Listener. Changing this creates a new Listener.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) Human-readable name for the Listener. Does not have
to be unique.

args.name: default_pool_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID of the default pool with which the
Listener is associated.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable description for the Listener.

args.name: connection_limit
args.description:
(Optional) The maximum number of connections allowed
for the Listener.

args.name: default_tls_container_ref
args.description:
(Optional) A reference to a Barbican Secrets
container which stores TLS information. This is required if the protocol
is TERMINATED_HTTPS. See
here
for more information.

args.name: sni_container_refs
args.description:
(Optional) A list of references to Barbican Secrets
containers which store SNI information. See
here
for more information.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the Listener.
A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID for the Listener.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
pool.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns
the pool.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own. Changing this creates a new pool.

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable name for the pool.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable description for the pool.

args.name: protocol
args.description:
= (Required) The protocol  can either be TCP, HTTP, HTTPS or PROXY.
Changing this creates a new pool.

args.name: loadbalancer_id
args.description:
(Optional) The load balancer on which to provision this
pool. Changing this creates a new pool.
Note:  One of LoadbalancerID or ListenerID must be provided.

args.name: listener_id
args.description:
(Optional) The Listener on which the members of the pool
will be associated with. Changing this creates a new pool.
Note:  One of LoadbalancerID or ListenerID must be provided.

args.name: lb_method
args.description:
(Required) The load balancing algorithm to
distribute traffic to the pool's members. Must be one of
ROUND_ROBIN, LEAST_CONNECTIONS, or SOURCE_IP.

args.name: persistence
args.description:
Omit this field to prevent session persistence.  Indicates
whether connections in the same session will be processed by the same Pool
member or not. Changing this creates a new pool.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Required) The type of persistence mode. The current specification
supports SOURCE_IP, HTTP_COOKIE, and APP_COOKIE.

args.name: cookie_name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the cookie if persistence mode is set
appropriately. Required if type = APP_COOKIE.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the pool.
A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID for the pool.

A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
member.

args.name: pool_id
args.description:
(Required) The id of the pool that this member will be
assigned to.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description: (Optional) The subnet in which to access the member

args.name: name
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable name for the member.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns
the member.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own. Changing this creates a new member.

args.name: address
args.description:
(Required) The IP address of the member to receive traffic from
the load balancer. Changing this creates a new member.

args.name: protocol_port
args.description:
(Required) The port on which to listen for client traffic.
Changing this creates a new member.

args.name: weight
args.description:
(Optional)  A positive integer value that indicates the relative
portion of traffic that this member should receive from the pool. For
example, a member with a weight of 10 receives five times as much traffic
as a member with a weight of 2.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the member.
A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID for the member.

the monitor.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own. Changing this creates a new monitor.

args.name: type

that is sent by the load balancer to verify the member state. Changing this
creates a new monitor.

args.name: delay

ping reply before it times out. The value must be less than the delay
value.

changing the member's status to INACTIVE. Must be a number between 1
and 10..

accessed if monitor type is HTTP or HTTPS.

args.name: http_method

(Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. The HTTP method used
for requests by the monitor. If this attribute is not specified, it
defaults to "GET".

args.name: expected_codes
args.description:
(Optional) Required for HTTP(S) types. Expected HTTP codes
for a passing HTTP(S) monitor. You can either specify a single status like
"200", or a range like "200-202".

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
L7 Policy.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns
the L7 Policy.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own. Changing this creates a new L7 Policy.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) Human-readable name for the L7 Policy. Does not have
to be unique.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable description for the L7 Policy.

args.name: action
args.description:
(Required) The L7 Policy action - can either be REDIRECT_TO_POOL,
REDIRECT_TO_URL or REJECT.

args.name: listener_id
args.description:
(Required) The Listener on which the L7 Policy will be associated with.
Changing this creates a new L7 Policy.

args.name: position
args.description: (Optional) The position of this policy on the listener. Positions start at 1.

args.name: redirect_pool_id
args.description:
(Optional) Requests matching this policy will be redirected to the
pool with this ID. Only valid if action is REDIRECT_TO_POOL.

args.name: redirect_url
args.description:
(Optional) Requests matching this policy will be redirected to this URL.
Only valid if action is REDIRECT_TO_URL.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the L7 Policy.
A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID for the L7 {olicy.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an . If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
L7 Rule.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) Required for admins. The UUID of the tenant who owns
the L7 Rule.  Only administrative users can specify a tenant UUID
other than their own. Changing this creates a new L7 Rule.

args.name: description
args.description: (Optional) Human-readable description for the L7 Rule.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Required) The L7 Rule type - can either be COOKIE, FILE_TYPE, HEADER,
HOST_NAME or PATH.

args.name: compare_type
args.description:
(Required) The comparison type for the L7 rule - can either be
CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH, EQUAL_TO or REGEX

args.name: l7policy_id
args.description:
(Required) The ID of the L7 Policy to query. Changing this creates a new
L7 Rule.

args.name: value
args.description:
(Required) The value to use for the comparison. For example, the file type to
compare.

args.name: key
args.description:
(Optional) The key to use for the comparison. For example, the name of the cookie to
evaluate. Valid when type is set to COOKIE or HEADER.

args.name: invert
args.description:
(Optional) When true the logic of the rule is inverted. For example, with invert
true, equal to would become not equal to. Default is false.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the L7 Rule.
A valid value is true (UP) or false (DOWN).

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID for the L7 Rule.

attrs.name: listener_id
attrs.description: The ID of the Listener owning this resource.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the v1 networking client.
A networking client is needed to create a firewall. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
firewall.

args.name: policy_id
args.description:
(Required) The policy resource id for the firewall. Changing
this updates the policy_id of an existing firewall.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) A name for the firewall. Changing this
updates the name of an existing firewall.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Required) A description for the firewall. Changing this
updates the description of an existing firewall.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) Administrative up/down status for the firewall
(must be "true" or "false" if provided - defaults to "true").
Changing this updates the admin_state_up of an existing firewall.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the floating IP. Required if admin wants
to create a firewall for another tenant. Changing this creates a new
firewall.

args.name: associated_routers
args.description:
(Optional) Router(s) to associate this firewall instance
with. Must be a list of strings. Changing this updates the associated routers
of an existing firewall. Conflicts with no_routers.

args.name: no_routers
args.description:
(Optional) Should this firewall not be associated with any routers
(must be "true" or "false" if provide - defaults to "false").
Conflicts with associated_routers.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the v1 networking client.
A networking client is needed to create a firewall policy. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
firewall policy.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) A name for the firewall policy. Changing this
updates the name of an existing firewall policy.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) A description for the firewall policy. Changing
this updates the description of an existing firewall policy.

args.name: rules
args.description:
(Optional) An array of one or more firewall rules that comprise
the policy. Changing this results in adding/removing rules from the
existing firewall policy.

args.name: audited
args.description:
(Optional) Audit status of the firewall policy
(must be "true" or "false" if provided - defaults to "false").
This status is set to "false" whenever the firewall policy or any of its
rules are changed. Changing this updates the audited status of an existing
firewall policy.

args.name: shared
args.description:
(Optional) Sharing status of the firewall policy (must be "true"
or "false" if provided). If this is "true" the policy is visible to, and
can be used in, firewalls in other tenants. Changing this updates the
shared status of an existing firewall policy. Only administrative users
can specify if the policy should be shared.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the v1 Compute client.
A Compute client is needed to create a firewall rule. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
firewall rule.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) A unique name for the firewall rule. Changing this
updates the name of an existing firewall rule.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) A description for the firewall rule. Changing this
updates the description of an existing firewall rule.

args.name: protocol
args.description:
(Required) The protocol type on which the firewall rule operates.
Valid values are: tcp, udp, icmp, and any. Changing this updates the
protocol of an existing firewall rule.

args.name: action
args.description:
(Required) Action to be taken ( must be "allow" or "deny") when the
firewall rule matches. Changing this updates the action of an existing
firewall rule.

args.name: ip_version
args.description:
(Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this
updates the ip_version of an existing firewall rule.

args.name: source_ip_address
args.description:
(Optional) The source IP address on which the firewall
rule operates. Changing this updates the source_ip_address of an existing
firewall rule.

args.name: destination_ip_address
args.description:
(Optional) The destination IP address on which the
firewall rule operates. Changing this updates the destination_ip_address
of an existing firewall rule.

args.name: source_port
args.description:
(Optional) The source port on which the firewall
rule operates. Changing this updates the source_port of an existing
firewall rule.

args.name: destination_port
args.description:
(Optional) The destination port on which the firewall
rule operates. Changing this updates the destination_port of an existing
firewall rule.

args.name: enabled
args.description:
(Optional) Enabled status for the firewall rule (must be "true"
or "false" if provided - defaults to "true"). Changing this updates the
enabled status of an existing firewall rule.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the firewall rule. Required if admin
wants to create a firewall rule for another tenant. Changing this creates a
new firewall rule.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to create the container. If
omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new container.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Required) A unique name for the container. Changing this creates a
new container.

args.name: container_read
args.description:
(Optional) Sets an access control list (ACL) that grants
read access. This header can contain a comma-delimited list of users that
can read the container (allows the GET method for all objects in the
container). Changing this updates the access control list read access.

args.name: container_sync_to
args.description:
(Optional) The destination for container synchronization.
Changing this updates container synchronization.

args.name: container_sync_key
args.description:
(Optional) The secret key for container synchronization.
Changing this updates container synchronization.

args.name: container_write
args.description:
(Optional) Sets an ACL that grants write access.
Changing this updates the access control list write access.

args.name: versioning
args.description: (Optional) Enable object versioning. The structure is described below.

args.name: type
args.description: (Required) Versioning type which can be versions or history according to Openstack documentation.

args.name: location
args.description: (Required) Container in which versions will be stored.

args.name: metadata
args.description:
(Optional) Custom key/value pairs to associate with the container.
Changing this updates the existing container metadata.

args.name: content_type
args.description:
(Optional) The MIME type for the container. Changing this
updates the MIME type.

args.name: force_destroy
args.description: (Optional, Default:false ) A boolean that indicates all objects should be deleted from the container so that the container can be destroyed without error. These objects are not recoverable.

args.name: container_name
args.description:
(Required) A unique (within an account) name for the container. 
The container name must be from 1 to 256 characters long and can start 
with any character and contain any pattern. Character set must be UTF-8. 
The container name cannot contain a slash (/) character because this 
character delimits the container and object name. For example, the path 
/v1/account/www/pages specifies the www container, not the www/pages container.

args.name: content
args.description:
(Optional) A string representing the content of the object. Conflicts with
source and copy_from.

args.name: content_disposition
args.description:
(Optional) A string which specifies the override behavior for 
 the browser. For example, this header might specify that the browser use a download
 program to save this file rather than show the file, which is the default.

args.name: content_encoding
args.description:
(Optional) A string representing the value of the Content-Encoding
 metadata.

args.name: content_type
args.description: (Optional) A string which sets the MIME type for the object.

args.name: copy_from
args.description:
(Optional) A string representing the name of an object 
used to create the new object by copying the copy_from object. The value is in form 
{container}/{object}. You must UTF-8-encode and then URL-encode the names of the 
container and object before you include them in the header. Conflicts with source and 
content.

args.name: delete_after
args.description:
(Optional) An integer representing the number of seconds after which the
system removes the object. Internally, the Object Storage system stores this value in 
the X-Delete-At metadata item.

args.name: delete_at
args.description:
(Optional) An string representing the date when the system removes the object. 
For example, "2015-08-26" is equivalent to Mon, Wed, 26 Aug 2015 00:00:00 GMT.

args.name: detect_content_type
args.description:
(Optional) If set to true, Object Storage guesses the content 
type based on the file extension and ignores the value sent in the Content-Type 
header, if present.

args.name: etag
args.description: (Optional) Used to trigger updates. The only meaningful value is ${md5(file("path/to/file"))}.

args.name: name
args.description: (Required) A unique name for the object.

args.name: object_manifest
args.description:
(Optional) A string set to specify that this is a dynamic large 
object manifest object. The value is the container and object name prefix of the
segment objects in the form container/prefix. You must UTF-8-encode and then 
URL-encode the names of the container and prefix before you include them in this 
header.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to create the container. If
omitted, the region argument of the provider is used. Changing this
creates a new container.

args.name: source
args.description:
(Optional) A string representing the local path of a file which will be used
as the object's content. Conflicts with source and copy_from.

attrs.name: content_length
attrs.description:
If the operation succeeds, this value is zero (0) or the 
length of informational or error text in the response body.

attrs.name: content_type
attrs.description:
If the operation succeeds, this value is the MIME type of the object. 
If the operation fails, this value is the MIME type of the error text in the response 
body.

attrs.name: date
attrs.description:
The date and time the system responded to the request, using the preferred 
format of RFC 7231 as shown in this example Thu, 16 Jun 2016 15:10:38 GMT. The 
time is always in UTC.

attrs.name: etag
attrs.description:
Whatever the value given in argument, will be overriden by the MD5 checksum of the uploaded object content. The value is not quoted. 
If it is an SLO, it would be MD5 checksum of the segments etags.

attrs.name: last_modified
attrs.description:
The date and time when the object was last modified. The date and time 
stamp format is ISO 8601:
   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:sshh:mm
For example, 2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00.
The hh:mm value, if included, is the time zone as an offset from UTC. In the previous 
example, the offset value is -05:00.

attrs.name: static_large_object
attrs.description: True if object is a multipart_manifest.

attrs.name: trans_id
attrs.description:
A unique transaction ID for this request. Your service provider might 
need this value if you report a problem.

args.name: region
args.description: (Optional) The region the tempurl is located in.

args.name: container
args.description: (Required) The container name the object belongs to.

args.name: object
args.description: (Required) The object name the tempurl is for.

args.name: ttl
args.description:
(Required) The TTL, in seconds, for the URL. For how long it should
be valid.

args.name: method
args.description:
(Optional) The method allowed when accessing this URL.
Valid values are GET, and POST. Default is GET.

args.name: regenerate
args.description:
(Optional) Whether to automatically regenerate the URL when
it has expired. If set to true, this will create a new resource with a new
ID and new URL. Defaults to false.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: Computed md5 hash based on the generated url

attrs.name: region
attrs.description: The region the endpoint is located in.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an IPSec policy. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
policy.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the policy. Changing this updates the name of
the existing policy.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the policy. Required if admin wants to
create a policy for another project. Changing this creates a new policy.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) The human-readable description for the policy.
Changing this updates the description of the existing policy.

args.name: auth_algorithm
args.description:
(Optional) The authentication hash algorithm. Valid values are sha1, sha256, sha384, sha512.
Default is sha1. Changing this updates the algorithm of the existing policy.

args.name: encapsulation_mode
args.description:
(Optional) The encapsulation mode. Valid values are tunnel and transport. Default is tunnel.
Changing this updates the existing policy.

args.name: encryption_algorithm
args.description:
(Optional) The encryption algorithm. Valid values are 3des, aes-128, aes-192 and so on.
The default value is aes-128. Changing this updates the existing policy.

args.name: pfs
args.description:
(Optional) The perfect forward secrecy mode. Valid values are Group2, Group5 and Group14. Default is Group5.
Changing this updates the existing policy.

args.name: transform_protocol
args.description:
(Optional) The transform protocol. Valid values are ESP, AH and AH-ESP.
Changing this updates the existing policy. Default is ESP.

args.name: lifetime
args.description:
(Optional) The lifetime of the security association. Consists of Unit and Value.


unit - (Optional) The units for the lifetime of the security association. Can be either seconds or kilobytes.
Default is seconds.

value - (Optional) The value for the lifetime of the security association. Must be a positive integer.
Default is 3600.

args.name: unit
args.description:
(Optional) The units for the lifetime of the security association. Can be either seconds or kilobytes.
Default is seconds.

args.name: value
args.description:
(Optional) The value for the lifetime of the security association. Must be a positive integer.
Default is 3600.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

attrs.name: lifetime
attrs.description:
See Argument Reference above.


unit - See Argument Reference above.

value - See Argument Reference above.

args.name: unit
args.description: See Argument Reference above.

args.name: value
args.description: See Argument Reference above.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a VPN service. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
service.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the policy. Changing this updates the name of
the existing policy.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the policy. Required if admin wants to
create a service for another policy. Changing this creates a new policy.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) The human-readable description for the policy.
Changing this updates the description of the existing policy.

args.name: auth_algorithm
args.description:
(Optional) The authentication hash algorithm. Valid values are sha1, sha256, sha384, sha512.
Default is sha1. Changing this updates the algorithm of the existing policy.

args.name: encryption_algorithm
args.description:
(Optional) The encryption algorithm. Valid values are 3des, aes-128, aes-192 and so on.
The default value is aes-128. Changing this updates the existing policy.

args.name: pfs
args.description:
(Optional) The perfect forward secrecy mode. Valid values are Group2, Group5 and Group14. Default is Group5.
Changing this updates the existing policy.

args.name: phase1_negotiation_mode
args.description:
(Optional) The IKE mode. A valid value is main, which is the default.
Changing this updates the existing policy.

args.name: ike_version
args.description:
(Optional) The IKE mode. A valid value is v1 or v2. Default is v1.
Changing this updates the existing policy.

args.name: lifetime
args.description:
(Optional) The lifetime of the security association. Consists of Unit and Value.


unit - (Optional) The units for the lifetime of the security association. Can be either seconds or kilobytes.
Default is seconds.

value - (Optional) The value for the lifetime of the security association. Must be a positive integer.
Default is 3600.

args.name: unit
args.description:
(Optional) The units for the lifetime of the security association. Can be either seconds or kilobytes.
Default is seconds.

args.name: value
args.description:
(Optional) The value for the lifetime of the security association. Must be a positive integer.
Default is 3600.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

attrs.name: lifetime

See Argument Reference above.


unit - See Argument Reference above.

value - See Argument Reference above.

args.name: value
args.description: See Argument Reference above.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create a VPN service. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
service.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the service. Changing this updates the name of
the existing service.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the service. Required if admin wants to
create a service for another project. Changing this creates a new service.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) The human-readable description for the service.
Changing this updates the description of the existing service.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the resource. Can either be up(true) or down(false).
Changing this updates the administrative state of the existing service.

args.name: subnet_id
args.description: (Optional) SubnetID is the ID of the subnet. Default is null.

args.name: router_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the router. Changing this creates a new service.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

attrs.name: status
attrs.description: Indicates whether IPsec VPN service is currently operational. Values are ACTIVE, DOWN, BUILD, ERROR, PENDING_CREATE, PENDING_UPDATE, or PENDING_DELETE.

attrs.name: external_v6_ip
attrs.description: The read-only external (public) IPv6 address that is used for the VPN service.

attrs.name: external_v4_ip
attrs.description: The read-only external (public) IPv4 address that is used for the VPN service.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an endpoint group. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
group.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the group. Changing this updates the name of
the existing group.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the group. Required if admin wants to
create an endpoint group for another project. Changing this creates a new group.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) The human-readable description for the group.
Changing this updates the description of the existing group.

args.name: type
args.description:
The type of the endpoints in the group. A valid value is subnet, cidr, network, router, or vlan.
Changing this creates a new group.

args.name: endpoints
args.description:
List of endpoints of the same type, for the endpoint group. The values will depend on the type.
Changing this creates a new group.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.
A Networking client is needed to create an IPSec site connection. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
site connection.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the connection. Changing this updates the name of
the existing connection.

args.name: tenant_id
args.description:
(Optional) The owner of the connection. Required if admin wants to
create a connection for another project. Changing this creates a new connection.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) The human-readable description for the connection.
Changing this updates the description of the existing connection.

args.name: admin_state_up
args.description:
(Optional) The administrative state of the resource. Can either be up(true) or down(false).
Changing this updates the administrative state of the existing connection.

args.name: ikepolicy_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the IKE policy. Changing this creates a new connection.

args.name: vpnservice_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the VPN service. Changing this creates a new connection.

args.name: local_ep_group_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID for the endpoint group that contains private subnets for the local side of the connection.
You must specify this parameter with the peer_ep_group_id parameter unless
in backward- compatible mode where peer_cidrs is provided with a subnet_id for the VPN service.
Changing this updates the existing connection.

args.name: ipsecpolicy_id
args.description: (Required) The ID of the IPsec policy. Changing this creates a new connection.

args.name: peer_id
args.description:
(Required) The peer router identity for authentication. A valid value is an IPv4 address, IPv6 address, e-mail address, key ID, or FQDN.
Typically, this value matches the peer_address value.
Changing this updates the existing policy.

args.name: peer_ep_group_id
args.description:
(Optional) The ID for the endpoint group that contains private CIDRs in the form < net_address > / < prefix > for the peer side of the connection.
You must specify this parameter with the local_ep_group_id parameter unless in backward-compatible mode
where peer_cidrs is provided with a subnet_id for the VPN service.

args.name: local_id
args.description:
(Optional) An ID to be used instead of the external IP address for a virtual router used in traffic between instances on different networks in east-west traffic.
Most often, local ID would be domain name, email address, etc.
If this is not configured then the external IP address will be used as the ID.

args.name: peer_address
args.description: (Required) The peer gateway public IPv4 or IPv6 address or FQDN.

args.name: psk
args.description: (Required) The pre-shared key. A valid value is any string.

args.name: initiator
args.description: (Optional) A valid value is response-only or bi-directional. Default is bi-directional.

args.name: peer_cidrs
args.description: (Optional) Unique list of valid peer private CIDRs in the form < net_address > / < prefix > .

args.name: dpd
args.description:
(Optional) A dictionary with dead peer detection (DPD) protocol controls.


action - (Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) action.
A valid value is clear, hold, restart, disabled, or restart-by-peer.
Default value is hold.

timeout - (Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) timeout in seconds.
A valid value is a positive integer that is greater than the DPD interval value.
Default is 120.

interval - (Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) interval, in seconds.
A valid value is a positive integer.
Default is 30.

args.name: action
args.description:
(Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) action.
A valid value is clear, hold, restart, disabled, or restart-by-peer.
Default value is hold.

args.name: timeout
args.description:
(Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) timeout in seconds.
A valid value is a positive integer that is greater than the DPD interval value.
Default is 120.

args.name: interval
args.description:
(Optional) The dead peer detection (DPD) interval, in seconds.
A valid value is a positive integer.
Default is 30.

args.name: mtu
args.description:
(Optional) The maximum transmission unit (MTU) value to address fragmentation.
Minimum value is 68 for IPv4, and 1280 for IPv6.

args.name: value_specs
args.description: (Optional) Map of additional options.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Shared File System client.
A Shared File System client is needed to create a security service. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
security service.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the security service. Changing this updates the name
of the existing security service.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) The human-readable description for the security service.
Changing this updates the description of the existing security service.

args.name: type
args.description:
(Required) The security service type - can either be active_directory,
kerberos or ldap.  Changing this updates the existing security service.

args.name: dns_ip
args.description:
(Optional) The security service DNS IP address that is used inside the
tenant network.

args.name: ou
args.description:
(Optional) The security service ou. An organizational unit can be added to
specify where the share ends up. New in Manila microversion 2.44.

args.name: user
args.description:
(Optional) The security service user or group name that is used by the
tenant.

args.name: password
args.description: (Optional) The user password, if you specify a user.

args.name: domain
args.description: (Optional) The security service domain.

args.name: server
args.description: (Optional) The security service host name or IP address.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID for the Security Service.

attrs.name: project_id
attrs.description: The owner of the Security Service.

args.name: region
args.description:
(Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Shared File System client.
A Shared File System client is needed to create a share network. If omitted, the
region argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new
share network.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) The name for the share network. Changing this updates the name
of the existing share network.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) The human-readable description for the share network.
Changing this updates the description of the existing share network.

args.name: neutron_net_id
args.description:
(Required) The UUID of a neutron network when setting up or updating
a share network. Changing this updates the existing share network if it's not used by
shares.

args.name: neutron_subnet_id
args.description:
(Required) The UUID of the neutron subnet when setting up or
updating a share network. Changing this updates the existing share network if it's
not used by shares.

args.name: security_service_ids
args.description:
(Optional) The list of security service IDs to associate with
the share network. The security service must be specified by ID and not name.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID for the Share Network.

attrs.name: project_id
attrs.description: The owner of the Share Network.

attrs.name: network_type
attrs.description: The share network type. Can either be VLAN, VXLAN, GRE, or flat.

attrs.name: ip_version
attrs.description: The IP version of the share network. Can either be 4 or 6.

args.name: region
args.description:
The region in which to obtain the V2 Shared File System client.
A Shared File System client is needed to create a share. Changing this
creates a new share.

args.name: name
args.description:
(Optional) The name of the share. Changing this updates the name
of the existing share.

args.name: description
args.description:
(Optional) The human-readable description for the share.
Changing this updates the description of the existing share.

args.name: share_proto
args.description:
(Required) The share protocol - can either be NFS, CIFS,
CEPHFS, GLUSTERFS, HDFS or MAPRFS. Changing this creates a new share.

args.name: size
args.description:
(Required) The share size, in GBs. The requested share size cannot be greater
than the allowed GB quota. Changing this resizes the existing share.

args.name: share_type
args.description:
(Optional) The share type name. If you omit this parameter, the default
share type is used.

args.name: snapshot_id
args.description:
(Optional) The UUID of the share's base snapshot. Changing this creates
a new share.

args.name: is_public
args.description:
(Optional) The level of visibility for the share. Set to true to make
share public. Set to false to make it private. Default value is false. Changing this
updates the existing share.

args.name: metadata
args.description:
(Optional) One or more metadata key and value pairs as a dictionary of
strings.

args.name: share_network_id
args.description:
(Optional) The UUID of a share network where the share server exists
or will be created. If share_network_id is not set and you provide a snapshot_id,
the share_network_id value from the snapshot is used. Changing this creates a new share.

args.name: availability_zone
args.description:
(Optional) The share availability zone. Changing this creates a
new share.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID for the Share.

attrs.name: export_locations
attrs.description:
A list of export locations. For example, when a share server
has more than one network interface, it can have multiple export locations.

attrs.name: has_replicas
attrs.description: Indicates whether a share has replicas or not.

attrs.name: share_server_id
attrs.description: The UUID of the share server.

args.name: region
args.description:
The region in which to obtain the V2 Shared File System client.
A Shared File System client is needed to create a share access. Changing this
creates a new share access.

args.name: share_id
args.description: (Required) The UUID of the share to which you are granted access.

args.name: access_type
args.description:
(Required) The access rule type. Can either be an ip, user,
cert, or cephx. cephx support requires an OpenStack environment that supports
Shared Filesystem microversion 2.13 (Mitaka) or later.

args.name: access_to
args.description:
(Required) The value that defines the access. Can either be an IP
address or a username verified by configured Security Service of the Share Network.

args.name: access_level
args.description: (Required) The access level to the share. Can either be rw or ro.

attrs.name: id
attrs.description: The unique ID for the Share Access.

attrs.name: access_key
attrs.description: The access credential of the entity granted access.
